title: Daily Evening Bhagavatam Discourse | HH Stoka Krishna Swami | SB 1.12.24 Part 1 | 29-08-2022
speaker: HH Stoka Krishna Swami

segments.text: Om Agyana Timiraandasya Gyananjanishalakaya Chakshuranmeelitam Yena Tasmai Shri Gurave Namaha
Nama Om Vishnupadaya Krishna Prishtaya Bhutale Shri Mate Bhaktivedanta Swamin Nithinamine
Namaste Saraswate Deve Gauravani Pracharine Nirvishesha Shunyavadi Pashchakya Deshatarine
Jaya Shri Krishna Chaitanya Prabhu Nithyananda Shri Advaita Gadadhara Shiva Sadhi Gauravakta Vrinda
Hare Krishna Hare Krishna Krishna Krishna Hare Hare Hare Rama Hare Rama Rama Rama Hare Hare
Om Namo Bhagavate Vasudevaya Narayanam Namaskritya Naramchaiva Narottamam
Deveem Saraswateem Vyasam Tato Jayam Udi Rayet
In this session,
we will be discussing from the 24th verse of the 12th chapter of the 1st canto of Srimad Bhagavatam.
This will be the first part of this discussion.
This entire verse will be discussed in three parts.
So part 1, the verse itself, the 24th verse.
Sarva Sadguna Mahatmya Esha Krishnam Anuvrataha
Rantideva Ivodaro Yayatir Iva Dharmikaha
Sarva Sadguna Mahatmya Esha Krishnam Anuvrataha
The meaning of this verse is
This child will be almost as good as Lord Sri Krishna
by following in his footsteps.
In magnanimity, he will be as great as King Rantideva.
And in religion, he will be like Maharaj Yayati.
So three comparisons have been made in this particular verse.
This comparison is being made by the,
by the brahmanas who are performing the jatakarma samskara of child parikshit,
just after his birth.
And brahmanas are addressing Maharaj Yudhishthira,
who was inquiring from the brahmanas,
will this child be having good qualities when he grows up,
and will he be a proper successor for me?
That's the,
that's the enquiry made by Yudhishthira.
And in response to that,
the brahmanas are describing this child is
going to grow up to be
a great devotee,
a pure devotee of the Lord,
and he'll have wonderful qualities.

what are those qualities.

the last instruction of Lord Sri Krishna in the Bhagavad Gita is that,
one should give up everything and should follow in the footsteps of the Lord alone.

This is Krishna's final instruction in the Bhagavad Gita.

Now how to associate with the Lord?
If that question is asked, Srila Prabhupada says,
to follow the instructions of the Lord is to associate with the Lord.
Why?
Why is it said like this?
Because the Lord is absolute.
There is no difference between the Lord,
His name, His form, His qualities,
His instructions, there is no difference.
Both are, all are absolute.
Advayagyana, this is called Advayagyana.
So there is no difference between the Lord and His instructions.
So to follow the instructions of the Lord means to associate with the Lord.

Now, regarding Parikshit, what is being told here?
Parikshit, it was told that this child will be almost as good as Lord Sri Krishna by following in his footsteps.
So, it is said here that Maharaj Parikshit associated with the Lord even from the womb of his mother up to the last day of his valuable life.
We discussed this earlier, when Parikshit was in his mother's womb, one Ashwatthama, son of Dronacharya,
he attempted to kill this last surviving descendant of the Pandavas.
And he was killed.
By releasing one Brahmastra.
Now, Brahmastra, it goes and strikes the target wherever the target is.
And only the target, nothing else.
But, Parikshit was saved from this attack of Brahmastra by Krishna personally.
And Krishna entered the womb of Parikshit's mother, Uttara.
Abhimanyu's wife.
So, Krishna entered personally and protected the child.
Because Krishna has interest in the pure devotee, special interest.
Ye bhajan titumam bhaktya maite teshu chaapyaham.
Krishna says this in the Bhagavad Gita.
Even though I am equal to everyone,
but I am specially inclined to my pure devotees.
That's what Krishna says in the Bhagavad Gita.
So, accordingly, Krishna entered the womb of Mother Uttara,
when Parikshit was present in that womb.
And Krishna neutralized the Brahmastra and Parikshit was saved.
And since that time,
his association with Krishna began till the end of his life.
The whole Bhagavatam is about Parikshit being cursed when he was ruling.
He was cursed to die untimely, to die within seven days.
And he accepted to quit the body after seven days.
But he wanted to prepare.
And he decided to go to holy place.
And actually,
Krishna prepared himself for quitting the body.
And he had association of saintly persons,
specially Srila Shukadeva Goswami,
from whom he heard the Bhagavatam.
So, till the end, he had association of Krishna in that way.
And he acquired all good qualities of Krishna in all perfection.
So, I will stop here.
Thank you very much.
Hare Krishna.
